channel.title: Wierd classnodeferror
channel.description:
hey guys i was trying to run my code and the run.bat comes up with this: [code] C:\Users\Joseph\Desktop\Java Tests>java Moon Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Moon Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Moon at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247) Could not find the main class: Moon. Program will exit.
C:\Users\Joseph\Desktop\Java Tests>pause Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
to run the run.bat i am using [code]java Moon[/code]
this came from a book "a beginners guide to java: 3rd edition"

item.title: Wierd classnodeferror
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Omer_, post:4, topic:429048”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=531739.msg3885883#msg3885883 date=1326424019]

Hurr no employer will hire you notepadfags. Atleast get Vim, shit.

I wasn’t saying that people shouldn’t use IDEs. IDEs are great tools. What I am saying is that people shouldn’t depend on IDEs to fix their problems. They should know how to identify and fix problems without the IDEs “hand-holding”.

True, but it seems to be a huge controversy around here that people actually do get “dependent” of an IDE. I’ve just never seen it actually happen so I’m not sure how high of a chance there is of actually getting completely dependent.

Well, as you can see[quote author=Omer_ link=topic=531739.msg3885649#msg3885649 date=1326413124]

Post the output of “dir” in the Command Prompt

That and use an IDE
[/quote][quote author=Omer_ link=topic=531739.msg3885655#msg3885655 date=1326413465]

zyle i dont understand. (please dont get mad) and the -cp idk where to put it. i put it between java and moon, and it still doesnt work. btw, i have same exact code, folder and everything on my other computer. its working on there but not this one.

Get an IDE
[/quote]

He has no idea what the problem is. He just knows that an IDE will tell you the problem, and give you “quick-fix” options, instead of understanding what the problem is, and the steps necessary to fix (or prevent) the problem.
[/quote]

You idiot, you can’t quick-fix that error in eclipse.[/quote]

Yes you can. The problem in this thread is that the JVM can’t find the specified class file. With eclipse, not only will it setup the build environment, it also has the suggestion of adding a specific class/library to the build path (“Fix Project setup”).

Read full topic

Get an IDE[/quote]

He has no idea what the problem is. He just knows that an IDE will tell you the problem, and give you “quick-fix” options, instead of understanding what the problem is, and the steps necessary to fix (or prevent) the problem.

item.title: Wierd classnodeferror
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:11, topic:429045”]Instead of: java Moon ’

Try: java -cp .; Moon

This actually does make a difference on some computers. For example my old laptop has to have the -cp there.[/quote]

It’s usually because “.” isn’t added to the PATH variable. Everytime I start programming on a different computer, I’ve had to add it manually.

Read full topic
